281.name: Buckler of Beelzebub
281.desc:
{Buckler of Beelzebub}

+2 to all primary skills. Places Dimension Door Spell in your hero's spell book. All allied creatures gain the no enemy retaliation ability.

282.desc: The wearer's primary attributes are increased by 1 for every five hero levels.

351.name: Cover of Darkness
351.desc: (Not attacked by heroes once per week)
351.buildingDesc0: The Cover of Darkness covers your city with a permanent shroud to all other players.
351.buildingDesc1: The Cover of Darkness reduces the morale of the intruder hero by -1 when defending against a siege.
351.objVisited: The Cover of Darkness only regenerates once a week, and someone has already been here this week.
351.heroVisited:
{Cover of Darkness}

The power within the Cover of Darkness can protect you from attacks by other heroes. However, you have already obtained this power.
351.visit:
{Cover of Darkness}

You have obtained a strange power within the Cover of Darkness. You cannot be attacked by the other heroes until the end of the second day. However, the effect of Cover of Darkness will immediately disappear after you enter a battle.

726.summon2: {Too many troops on the battlefield. Summon failed.}
726.summon3: {There is no space to summon elementals near the hero.}
726.slayerSpec:
{Slayer}

An additional 10% of enemy creature's hit points can be diminished.

737.heroScr: Do you wish to destroy the war machine?

739.desc1:
{Basic Pathfinding}

Reduces the movement penalty for rough terrain:

Grass and Subterranean: by 5 move points
Dirt and Lava: by 10 move points
Rough: by 15 move points
Desert and Snow: by 20 move points
Swamp: by 25 move points
739.desc2:
{Advanced Pathfinding}

Reduces the movement penalty for rough terrain:

Grass and Subterranean: by 10 move points
Dirt and Lava: by 20 move points
Rough: by 30 move points
Desert and Snow: by 40 move points
Swamp: by 50 move points
739.desc3:
{Expert Pathfinding}

Reduces the movement penalty for rough terrain:

Grass and Subterranean: by 15 move points
Dirt and Lava: by 30 move points
Rough: by 45 move points
Desert and Snow: by 60 move points
Swamp: by 75 move points

740.spec:
{Creature Specialist}

Creatures that the hero specializes on receive the following bonuses:

+1 speed,
+1 to attack skill for every even level of the hero,
+1 to defense skill for every odd level of the hero.

743.desc1:
{Rings of Vitality}

Increases the health of living creatures by 5%.
743.desc2:
{Ring of Life}

Increases the health of living creatures by 5%.
743.desc3:
{Vial of Liveblood}

Increases the health of living creatures by 10%.

744.dlg:
@hero@ has enough skill to repair the broken war machines. But repairs will take some time and require paying a local craftsmen.

Do you want to repair the broken war machine(s)?

747.desc: @percent@% of unused movement points convert to experience points

748.dlg:
Do you want to give up ownership of this dwelling?

{After divesting ownership, all creatures in this dwelling become its guards.}

751.desc1:
{Basic Necromancy}

Animate 15% of the hero's own combat casualties
751.desc2:
{Advanced Necromancy}

Animate 30% of the hero's own combat casualties
751.desc3:
{Expert Necromancy}

Animate 50% of the hero's own combat casualties

752.desc: Evades indirect attacks and damaging spells.

756.name: {Siegecraft}
756.desc1:
{Basic Siegecraft}

Control of catapult
1 aimed shot
Increased damage
Increases moat and tower damage by +10% when under siege
756.desc2:
{Advanced Siegecraft}

Control of catapult
2 aimed shot
Increased damage
Increases moat and tower damage by +20% when under siege
756.desc3:
{Expert Siegecraft}

Control of catapult
2 aimed shot
Maximum damage
Increases moat and tower damage by +30% when under siege

757.dlg1:
Dragon Utopia

It is said that some Dragon Utopias can be rebuilt into new towns by talented builders.
757.tooManyTowns: Yet there are too many towns in this world! Your builders refuse to cooperate as building more towns no longer raises them any interest.
757.tooNarrow: Yet the one in front of you is definitely not the case as the surroundings are too narrow.
757.dlg2:
Dragon Utopia

There is a strengthened fort here that can be rebuilt into a castle and mages will surely rebuild the Dragon Library into a Mage Guild.
757.ask: Do you want to build a town here?
757.notEnoughRes: Unfortunately, you can't afford rebuilding the Dragon Utopia.

758.desc: No morale from heroes. Gets bloodthirsty from killing an enemy.

762.battleLog0: @flesheater@ eats the remains of the enemies and restores @hp@ life!
762.battleLog1: @flesheater@ eat the remains of the enemies and restore @hp@ life!

765.dlg: After securing @town@, you loot the treasury!

766.desc: Stacks of living creatures in the hero's army are replenished weekly by @percent@%

768.enable: Enable the reminder of Monster Resources
768.ask:
The @mon@ had resources. Do you want to collect them?

(Right-click on minimap to re-enable option display)
768.opt1: Yes, collect the resources, uses 500 movement points (Currently: @movement@).
768.opt2: No, don't collect the resources, I'm in a hurry!
768.opt3: Yes, collect them every time and don't display these options again.
768.opt4: No, don't collect them and don't display these options again.
768.fled: After the @mon@ fled, @hero@'s army searches the camp and finds some treasure they left behind!
768.defeated: After defeating the @mon@, @hero@'s army searches the camp and finds treasure!

769.singEncounter: As you approach the @mon@, you can see that it's jealously guarding the {@art@}!
769.plurEncounter: As you approach the @mon@, you can see that they're jealously guarding the {@art@}!
769.leave: Now, with the threat eliminated, @hero@ obtains:

770.msg: @tyrant@ player has become the tyrant, owning all the neutral towns, mines, and level 1-4 dwellings in this land.

773.logSpec:
{Logistics}

Receives 5% per level bonus to Logistics skill percentage

774.desc1: The hero collects an amount of experience that can be transmitted when leveling up
774.desc2: The hero collects an amount of experience that can be transmitted when leveling up (accumulates twice as much experience and the training time is reduced by half)
774.desc3: The hero collects an amount of experience that can be transmitted when leveling up (accumulates three times more experience and the training time is reduced threefold)

775.dwell79:
You come! You bring food?
{* huge troll comes out to meet you *}
Trolls big. Eating little.
Trolls starve. Animals tasty.
Riders delicious. Trolls must eat.
Trolls protect you. Trolls are good.
Yes?

{[You will receive: @num@ @mon@]}

776.name: {El. Suppression}
776.desc: Reduces the opponent's magic skills in all schools by @lv@ level
776.neutralized: (neutralized by any "suppressing artifacts" and Elemental Suppression skill of the enemy)
776.spec:
{Elemental Suppression}

Acts like an additional level of the {Elemental Suppression} skill

777.desc: Reduces magic damage received for heroes armies by @percent@%

779.dlg:
{Learning Stone}

The Wisdom of the Ages is carved on this stone. Part of you understands but the rest will forever remain as an enigma...

782.name: {Medicine}
782.battleLog: First Aid Tent healing is increased by @hp@ points.

783.ask: I could teach you for a modest fee of @gold@ gold. Do you accept?
783.cantAfford: If you want me to train you, come back when you can pay @gold@ gold for the training.
783.noNew: Sorry, but I can not teach you anything new.
783.spell0: All you have to study is a Spell Book and @gold@ gold.
783.spell1: All you have to study is Basic Wisdom, a Spell Book and @gold@ gold.
783.spell2: All you have to study is Advanced Wisdom, a Spell Book and @gold@ gold.
783.spell3: All you have to study is Expert Wisdom, a Spell Book and @gold@ gold.

785.dlg1:
Peons in this town bring you @gold@ gold every day.
Which units do you want to disband and depart for work?
785.dlg2:
Peons in this town bring you @gold@ gold every day.
Garrison units can be sent to work.

786.descA: Reduces hiring or upgrade cost for creatures from map objects up to @percent1@% (gold only)
786.scholar: Reduces the cost of training from a scholar by @percent@%

787.desc:
Allows you to additionally restore spell points:

Up to @percent1@% (minimum of @min1@) per night when outside a town
Up to @percent2@% (minimum of @min2@) when visiting a magic well or spending the night in a town with a Mage Guild
787.spec:
{Mysticism}

Allows you to additionally restore spell points:

Up to 3% (minimum of 1) per night when outside a town.
Up to 20% (minimum of 20) when visiting a magic well or spending the night in a town with a Mage Guild
787.heroScr:
SP is restored daily at a rate of 3% of the max. number of SP (but not if the hero has less than 1 SP). Staying overnight in a town enhances this by up to 20% (min. of 20 SP) for each level of the Mage Guild the town has.
{@hero@} staying overnight at this location will restore up to {@regenSp@} SP.

788.battlemage:
{Battlemage}

The hero gets a bonus to spell damage by {5%} per level.
788.creaSpec:
{Creature Specialist}

With changes to the hero's specialization, creatures now recieve some bonuses to stats.
788.skillMaster:
{Skill Master}

The hero's specialization can now be used more effectively.
788.supplier0:
{Supplier}

The hero now brings {1} additional resource daily (related to specialization) to the town treasury.
788.supplier1:
{Supplier}

The hero now brings {350 gold} to the town treasury in addition to daily income.
788.auraOfCurse0:
{Aura Curse}

The hero is given a curse that halves the {attack} of all units on the battlefield.
788.auraOfCurse1:
{Aura Curse}

The hero is given a curse that halves the {defense} of all units on the battlefield.
788.auraOfCurse2:
{Aura Curse}

The hero is given a curse that forces all units on the battlefield to only deal {minimal damage}.
788.auraOfCurse3:
{Aura Curse}

The hero is given a curse that halves the {speed} of all units on the battlefield.
788.battleLog: {The aura of an ancient curse affects all units.}

789.desc: Gives @percent@% chance to deal x1.5 spell damage to each target

790.dlg:
Spend all mana for this spell?

The expected damage is: @dmg@.

791.dlg:
It's an ambush!

You are surrounded by bandits!

793.name: {Economy}
793.desc1:
{Basic Economy}

Increases the daily income of towns by 5%
793.desc2:
{Advanced Economy}

Increases the daily income of towns by 10%
793.desc3:
{Expert Economy}

Increases the daily income of towns by 15%
793.spec:
{Economy}

Increase the daily income of towns by 5%

794.title:
Reveal map.

Choose which players to reveal the map for:

795.desc: Scouts up to @range@ squares during the night

assassins.appear: {A squad of Assassins appears from the shadows!}
assassins.disappear: {A squad of Assassins dissolves into the shadows!}
assassins.noUnits:
This hero is not accompanied by {Assassins}.

We might have to track some down.
assassins.header:
This hero is accompanied by a detachment of loyal {Assassins}.

Amount: @num@ units.
assassins.allow:
Assassins are {allowed} to participate in battles

Do you want to disallow Assassins from participating in battles?
assassins.restrict:
Assassins are {not allowed} to participate in battles.

Do you want to allow Assassins to participate in battles?
assassins.capture: Assassins of the defeated enemy request the hero to use their lives in exchange for gold or loyalty.

796.scroll: Do you want to destroy the scroll with the spell @spell@ to get @sp@ spell points?
796.banner:
Do you want to reward the troops this banner to inspire a second wind?
{+500 movement points for 3 days starting tomorrow.}
796.art:
Are you sure you want to sacrifice this artifact without aid from the altar?
(This sacrifice will only give @exp@ experience points.)

822.battleLog: @mon@ managed to block the next attack.

878.exp1: Accept these books as a gift. You can learn a lot by reading them.
878.exp2: Let me share my knowledge with you.
878.exp3: I wish you to be enlighted in knowledge.
878.dlg:
@person@ approaches you:
"Thank you for expelling @enemy@ without bloodshed. @exp@"

879.109_Sent:
{Water Wheel}

This week the miller has already sent gold. Nothing new until next week.
879.109_Owned:
{Water Wheel}

The water wheel is now under your control. Now every week, the miller will bring you gold.
879.112_Sent:
{Windmill}

This week the miller has already sent resources. Nothing new until next week.
879.112_Owned:
{Windmill}

The windmill is now under your control. Now every week, the miller will bring you resources.
879.55_Sent:
{Mystical Garden}

This week the leprechaun has already sent you what he owed. Nothing new until next week.
879.55_Owned:
{Mystical Garden}

You captured the Mystical Garden. Now every week, the leprechaun will bring you gold or gems.

880.noHero: Only visiting heroes may study spell scrolls.
880.noBook: You have no spell book to study spell scrolls.
880.ask: Do you want to write spells from your scrolls to your Spell Book for @gold@ gold?
880.cantAfford: You do not have enough gold to pay.
880.noScroll: You have no spell scroll we could write in your Spell Book.

881.noPoint: You do not have any free skill points.
881.ask2: How many skill points to add?

995.battleLog: Death Stare deals @dmg@ damage. @kill@ creatures die.
